page.title: 14Leisure- Rode and Southwick.
page.content: Playing fields in both villages are well used and there are play areas for small children. Southwick has 2 cricket and 3 football teams; Rode has a cricket team. The village schools use the fields for games. There is a large pavilion at Rode, built in 1984 by volunteers and financed by village efforts. It is used by the Band, Brownies and evening classes. The small wooden Southwick pavilion is only used for changing; refreshments are provided at the village hall on the same site. Functions, flower shows fetes and car boot sales are held on the fields. Local pubs have darts and skittles teams and clay pigeon shoots are held in Rode. There is fishing in the river Frome. Rode village choir practices in the church. Southwick has a video library and beer and wine making are popular.
